units.title: Puromycin selection of CAG::Cas9 hiPS cells
units.text: Once the seeded cells reached 70–80% confluency, 1 µg ml−1 of puromycin in StemFlex medium (Life Technologies, catalogue no. A3349401) was supplemented for 5 days.
units.rationale: Describes the antibiotic selection step for edited hiPS cells.

units.title: Passaging hiPS cell colonies
units.text: To passage hiPS cell colonies, cells were incubated with 0.5 mM EDTA for 7 min at room temperature, resuspended in Essential 8 medium and distributed into new six-well plates.
units.rationale: Provides a concrete method for subculturing hiPS colonies.

units.title: Design and cloning of CRISPR sgRNA library
units.text: The interneuron migration CRISPR sgRNA library was designed by selecting up to five sgRNAs targeting each of the 438 genes of interest and an extra 10% ‘safe’ harbour-targeting negative control sgRNAs (Supplementary Table 2)54. Cloning restriction sites and amplification primer handles were appended to each oligo. The sgRNA library oligos were synthesized on the Agilent chip oligo array synthesis platform and cloned into a lentiviral plasmid vector that constitutively expresses the sgRNA and mCherry.
units.rationale: Outlines the creation of a pooled sgRNA library for screening.

units.title: Generation of 3D human cortical organoids (hCO)
units.text: To generate 3D hCO, hiPS cells were dissociated with accutase to obtain a single-cell suspension. About 3 × 10^6 cells per AggreWell 800 plate well in Essential 8 medium supplemented with the ROCK inhibitor Y27632 (10 µM). The plate was centrifuged at 100 g for 3 min and incubated overnight at 37 °C with 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Details the initial aggregation step for cortical organoid formation.

units.title: Transfer of aggregates to ultra‑low attachment dishes
units.text: The next day (day 0), cellular aggregates were transferred into ultra-low attachment plastic dishes (Corning, catalogue no. 3262) and cultured in Essential 6 medium (Thermo Fisher Scientific, catalogue no. A1516401) supplemented with dorsomorphin (2.5 µM, Sigma‑Aldrich, catalogue no. P5499), SB-431542 (10 µM, R&D Systems, catalogue no. 1614) and XAV-939 (1.25 µM, Tocris, catalogue no. 3748).
units.rationale: Specifies the medium composition and vessel for organoid maturation.

units.title: Patterning and neural differentiation of organoids
units.text: Organoids were cultured in E6 medium with patterning molecules from days 2 to 5. On day 6, organoids were transferred to neural medium containing Neurobasal A (Thermo Fisher, catalogue no. 10888022), B-27 supplement without vitamin A (Life Technologies, catalogue no. 12587), GlutaMax (1:100, Life Technologies, catalogue no. 35050061) and penicillin‑streptomycin (1:100, Thermo Fisher, catalogue no. 15140163).
units.rationale: Describes the switch to neural differentiation medium.

units.title: Growth factor supplementation schedule
units.text: From day 6 to 24, neural medium was supplemented with 20 ng ml−1 EGF (R&D Systems) and 20 ng ml−1 FGF2 (R&D Systems) with daily medium change in the first 10 days, and the lentivirally integrated sgRNA spacer sequence using the Herculase II Fusion DNA Polymerase (Agilent, catalogue no. 600679). From day 25 to day 43, neural medium was supplemented with 20 ng ml−1 brain‑derived neurotrophic factor (Peprotech, catalogue no. 450-02) and 20 ng ml−1 NT‑3 (Peprotech, catalogue no. 450-03). From day 44, only neural medium without growth factors was used for medium changes every 4 days.
units.rationale: Provides a detailed timeline for growth factor additions during organoid culture.

units.title: Preparation of sequencing libraries from sgRNA integrations
units.text: Sample‑specific sequencing libraries were prepared from the extracted genomic DNA of each collected sample by amplifying and barcoding the lentivirally integrated sgRNA spacer sequence using the Herculase II Fusion DNA Polymerase (Agilent, catalogue no. 600679). Samples were pooled and sequenced on Illumina NextSeq 550 flow cells at 450–1,000× read depth.
units.rationale: Outlines the workflow for generating libraries to read sgRNA representation.

units.title: Assembly of forebrain assembloids (hFA)
units.text: To generate hFA, hCO and hSO were generated separately and assembled by placing them in close proximity in 24‑well low attachment plates (Corning, catalogue no. 3473), which were placed slightly tilted in the incubator. Medium was changed 3 days later.
units.rationale: Describes the physical assembly of cortical and subpallial organoids into an assembloid.

units.title: Screen data analysis with casTLE
units.text: Screen results were analysed using the casTLE software54, a maximum likelihood estimator that provides for each gene: a casTLE score, a log‑likelihood ratio that considers the relative enrichment or depletion of each gene‑targeting sgRNA compared to the distribution of negative control sgRNA effects, a casTLE effect size, a log2‑transformed maximum likelihood estimate of the ratio of cells containing sgRNAs targeting a given gene in one sample compared to another, normalized to the median difference of negative control sgRNAs.
units.rationale: Specifies the computational tool and metrics used to interpret the CRISPR screen.
